children.subject: Help to support Cal robotics! Go Bears!
The organizer of this, Boyuan, does excellent work.

history.content:
Hi, everyone

Do you love robots? Do you think knowledge in EECS classes should be cool, running in real life instead on exam paper? Are you looking for students who do engineering 100% for fun and 100% with love? Do you enjoy FTC or FRC in high school, and hope to join some college level robotics team?

We (Robomasters@Berkeley) are building a team who can represent Cal to participant in DJI ICRA 2019 Robomaster AI Challenge! The competition involves building an AI controlled robot to compete in teams in real life a FPS shooting game. It will be held at IEEE Robotics and Automation Society's flagship conference ICRA, so the game will be a combination of research and industry-oriented skills. DJI is the world's largest drone producer and leader in AI controlled robots. 

We prefer members with the following skills to join the 2019 team, but ANY robot lovers are welcomed to apply as we hope give Cal community passion and chance to do robotics. 

Technical: ROS(EE106A), Data Structure and Algorithms(61B/170), Deep Learning, PID control, Computer Vision, Path Planning, Reinforcement learning(188), SLAM, Sensors, Circuit,Mechanical Engineering or Math.

Non-technical: Business intelligence, Art, Website etc.

We are currently at the registration stage, so contact me ASAP through boyuanchen@berkeley.edu and also fill out the form https://goo.gl/forms/sMLypKvyeDg5myJD2

At the beginning of spring 2019 we will probability driving the robot in campus. 

I am currently in China so I might have a delay in replying emails, but will reply as soon as I can. I will also go back to campus by 14th so feel free to discuss face to face!

Feel free to forward this to your friends or piazza, we would be especially grateful if anyone could post this to EE106AB piazza!

DJI Robomaster Series Competition Home Page: https://www.robomaster.com/en-US

DJI RM Challenge on ICRA website: https://www.icra2019.org/competitions/dji-robomaster-ai-challenge 

DJI also sponsored plenty of awards:

  • 1st Prize: USD $ 20,000
  • 2nd Prize: USD $ 15,000
  • 3rd Prize: USD $10,000
  • 4th Prize: USD $5,000
  • 5th – 8th Prize: USD $2,000

A small group of robot lovers at Berkeley have borrowed and paid a significant amount of $ to start the team as we really really longed for a robotics community like this, donations and help in fundraising would be appreciated to help us pay back the bill. Win the award and be the champion!
